qas.question: What religion is practiced by the vast majority of Samoans?
What word that means human relationships is at the core of Samoa's culture?
What word is used in Samoa to mean "respect"?
What percentage of Samoans call themselves Christians?
What religion is practiced by the fa'aaloalo?
What word encapsulates the core beliefs of Christianity?
How much of the population believe in fa'a Samoa?
What is the practice of Christianity based on?
What happened when fa'a Samoa was introduced?

context: Some Samoans are spiritual and religious, and have subtly adapted the dominant religion of <a0_0>Christianity<a0_0/> to 'fit in' with fa'a Samoa and vice versa. As such, ancient beliefs continue to co-exist side-by-side with Christianity, particularly in regard to the traditional customs and rituals of fa'a Samoa. The Samoan culture is centred around the principle of <a1_0><b5_0>vāfealoa'i<b5_0/><a1_0/>, the relationships between people. These relationships are based on <b7_0>respect<b7_0/>, or <a2_0>fa'aaloalo<a2_0/>. When <b4_0>Christianity<b4_0/> was introduced in Samoa, <b8_0>most Samoan people converted<b8_0/>. Currently <a3_0><b6_0>98%<b6_0/><a3_0/> of the population identify themselves as Christian.
